Él es originario del Jicaral, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y vio la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos, en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus cerdos por encargo a clientes fijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos que se lo ofrecen a buen precio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Nestor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a  personas  de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Néstor, 33, is the single father of three dependent, primary school children, ages 8, 6, and 4. He is from Jicaral, located in the western part of the country. He is hardworking, responsible, and anxious to succeed. Sadly, he lacked money to become a professional and had to start working at an early age. Thanks to his effort and desire to get ahead, he sells pigs from his house. He works about eight hours a day and sells the pigs to regular customers.

The purpose of the loan is to buy a lot of pigs that have been offered to him at a good price so that he can increase his earnings. Nestor thanks the Kiva lenders who offer low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua the means to decent work.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Cesar Emanuel

texts.es: El Joven  Cesar  de 30 años es soltero vive en casa con sua padres el   inicio  su negocio  de  Ferreteria  desde hace  6 años y con el  esfuerzo y la dedicacion  ha podido sacar adelnte su pequeño negocio,   el dia de hoy  el  esta  solicitando un credito para  la ampliación  de su negocio  y para comprar  mercancia que le hace falta,  su proposito es que   cada vez  mejoren   sus ventas  y  que sus clientes lo visiten mas seguido  pero para que suceda eso el tiene que dar una mejor imagen  a sus clientes y  tener  toda la  mercancia que sus clientes le soliciten.   Su  objetivo es progresar en el negocio y asi dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener mas utilidad para  asi  seguir creciendo en su negocio. el prestamo que se le otorgue el  lo invertira en la ampliación  de su negocio y en comprar  mas mercancia .
texts.en: Young César, 30, is single living in his parents’ house.  He started his hardware business six years ago and with much effort and dedication has succeeded in moving his small business forward.  Today, he’s requesting a loan to enlarge the store and to buy merchandise he needs.  His goal is that his sales will improve each time and his customers will visit him more often but in order for that to happen he has to present a better image to his customers and to have everything they need on-hand.  His goal is to make progress in the business to provide better customer service and earn higher profits so the business will continue to grow.  The loan he’ll be granted will be used to enlarge the business and to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to enlarge the shop.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married mother of two school-aged children, 13 and 7 years old. She lives with her family, in the vicinity of a little town of approximately 10,000 residents, located in northern Albania.

For five years now, she’s been operating her little livestock activity, which has been growing steadily and slowly. ”This is my only income for the whole family, and I’m very grateful that I started such an activity. With a bit of hard work, it’s not bad financially, at all. I sell milk to the local market of the nearby town, so it’s not hard to reach the market,” said Lina.

Lina is applying for a loan for the first time. She will use it to build a stable for the animals. All she hopes is that lenders will help her financially.

loans.use: To build a stable for the animals

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Cesar es Comerciante tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación venta de productos necesario y básicos para el hogar. 

Además tiene un carro de venta de comidas rápidas, como pizza, hot dog, hamburguesas.

Es casado tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad uno a su cargo en edad escolar. Su esposa trabaja, tiene veinte y cinco años de laborar.

El dinero lo solicita para compra de granos básicos y productos lácteos. 

expresó sentirse muy bien trabajar con ceprodel y kiva porque ha visto su crecimiento como persona y el de su familia, tiene una mejor calidad de vida gracias a kiva que le ha financiado todos los créditos solicitado y los ha invertido en su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia Cear is a merchant. He has a grocery store in his house where he sells basic household necessities.

He also has a cart from which he sells fast foods like pizza, hot dogs, and hamburgers. 

He is married and has four adult children and one school-aged child under his care. His wife works; she has worked for 25 years.

The money he is requesting is for the purchase of staple grains and dairy products.

He expressed that he feels very good about working with Ceprodel and Kiva because he has seen the growth in himself as a person and in his family. He has a better quality of life thanks to Kiva, which has financed all his requested loans; he invested those loans in his house and his business.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods: rice, sugar, beans, oil, and dairy products like cheese, cream, and milk.

loans.name: Rosa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rosa de 57 años de edad, casada con tres hijos,  mayores, e independiente económicamente, ella es originaria de Managua, lugar que esta. Ubicado en la zona central del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona, trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo estudiar, y desde temprana edad se vio motivada a trabajar.
Gracias s su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por activad económica la venta de comida, y lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. Ella ofrece comida corriente casera a estudiantes y trabajadores de una zona universidad cercana. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 9 horas diarias ofreciendo comida como pollo frito, carne asada, carne en vaho, carne sofrita, pollo en caldillo, indio viejo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles como  Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57, is married with three adult, economically independent children. She’s from Managua located in the middle of the country. She’s noted for being a hardworking, responsible person who wants to improve personally.  Sadly, because of the lack of economic resources she was unable to study and had to start working at a very young age.

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to get ahead her economic activity is selling food.  The business is located in a specific place in the location.  She offers home-cooked basic meals to students and workers in a nearby university zone.  She’ spends about 9 hours daily at work offering such dishes as fried chicken, grilled meat, steamed meat, sautéed meat, chicken soup and ‘indio viejo’ [corn-based stew].  

The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock the business.  She will buy food items so that in the not too distant future she can earn higher income.  Rosa thanks Kiva lenders for the help they give to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Engjellushe

texts.en:
Engjellushe is a Roma woman, who has been selling second-hand clothes, in a large city in south-central Albania. She is thirty-five years old and has six children, the youngest one being two years old.

She is requesting a loan for the first time from the VisionFund Albania institution. She will use the loan to buy some more seasonal, used items to resell. 

“The income I generate from this activity is the only one to support all of us, and honestly, it is not easy to live on it. But thank God that we even have this; otherwise I don’t know what we would have done. We live under very poor conditions, as you can see,” Engellushe said, showing the one-room house where the family of eight resides, with no running water or toilet.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal, second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor Jose habita en el municipio de La Concepcion junto a su esposa e hijos, hombre trabajador humilde, desde muy joven se dedica al trabajo de la tierra actualmente tiene una  manzana de piña cultivada y quiere darle mantenimiento ya que con las plagas que asechan a los cultivo no quiere que  le perjudique, con este credito comprar los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios como: Triple, Completo, Urea etc. gracias a este financiamiento su cosecha sera de calidad y sus ingresos mejorar, Muy conteneto agradece a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose lives in the municipality of La Concepción with his wife and children. He is a hardworking and modest man who has worked in farming since he was very young. He currently owns a "manzana" (unit of land measurement) of cultivated pineapple and wants to maintain it and protect it from the plagues. 

He plans to use this loan to buy the necessary supplies and fertilizers, such as Triple, Completo, Urea, etc. Thanks to this financing, his harvest will be of high quality and his income will improve. He is glad and grateful to Afodenic and Kiva Microfunds for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Milena Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Milena, mujer humilde y trabajadora desde muy joven se dedica a trabajar la tierra, ya que ha sido su medio de sustento durante muchos años, madre soltera y luchadora, actualmete tiene en cosecha una manzana  de piña y una manzana de Pitahaya, pero requiere de capital para darle mantenimiento a la piña, ya que el mal tiempo y las plagas le estan ocasionando algunos daños, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara los insumos y fertilizantes como: Triple, Completo, Urea, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Milena’s a humble, hardworking woman who has worked in the fields since she was very young; this has been her means of support for many years.  She’s a hardworking single mother who is currently growing apples, pineapples and a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of dragon fruit but needs capital to provide maintenance for the pineapples because the bad weather and infestations are causing some damage.  She will use the granted loan to buy supplies like Triple, Completo, urea, etc. and fertilizer.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva have provided.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhtulga, 42 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

He has been working as a welder at a building company since 2010. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. His daughter goes to high school and his son studies at eleventh grade of high school. 

Munkhtulga is requesting a loan of MNT 1,000,000 to purchase building materials, such as bricks, planks, and cement. Using these materials, he wants to repair his house and the fences surrounding his land. As a result, his family will reduce their coal consumption, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less pollutants. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, such as bricks, planks, and cement.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es: El señor Alejandro habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora como comerciante de nacatamales, don Alejandro desde hace varios años trabaja en un empresa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su sueldo no es suficiente para poder realizar de una sola vez la reconstrucción de su casa, con este financiamiento compra materiales como: zinc, Perlines, Bloques, Cemento, etc. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva
texts.en: Alejandro lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  His wife helps out with household expenses since she works selling nacatamales [Nicaragua-style tamales].  Alejandro has worked for a private firm for many years.  His greatest difficulty is that his salary is insufficient to rebuild his house all at once.  With this loan he will buy supplies like metal sheeting, roofing purlins, concrete blocks, cement, etc.  He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides by means of Kiva funds.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finish building a bedroom in his parents' house

loans.name: Marvin Alonso

texts.es:
Marvin de 48 años de edad, casado con tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Él es originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo cual lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de repuesto de vehículos, lugar que está ubicado en un lugar específico de su localidad. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de repuesto como llantas, aceite, frenos, rines, neumáticos.  Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Marvin agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 48-year old man, married and father of three children who are under his responsibility. He is from Managua, located in the central part of the country. He is known for being a hardworking and responsible man with a strong willingness of self-improvement. Unfortunately, he could not attend university and needed to work since he was very young. For this reason, he fights every day to provide his children with a better future. 

Thanks to his hard work and willingness to get ahead, he started his business selling spare parts for vehicles. He enjoys his job and works approximately 10 hours per day. He will use the loan to invest in working capital and to buy spare parts for his business, such as wheel rims, oil, breaks and tires, with a final goal of improving his income in a near future. 

Marvin is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua and for making it possible for them to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy spare parts for vehicles, such as wheel rims, oil, breaks and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Leticia Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora  Leticia  de 37 años  de edad es madre soltera  vive con sus  dos hijos s en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña Leticia su negocio ubicado en una colonia San Lorenzo, valle  al sur de Honduras, su negocio es la venta de todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, gracias a su actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Leticia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de papel higiénico, aguas, manteca, azúcar y también para la compra de  ropa para señoras que es otra de sus actividades  y así aprovechar   el día de las madres ya que  tiene varios pedidos  con el apoyo del préstamo desea suplir su necesidad de financiamiento y realizar su proyecto.
Doña Leticia su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Leticia, 37, is a single mother living with her two children in her house; for the last five years she’s been a grocer.  Her store is located in the San Lorenzo Valle neighborhood in southern Honduras.  She sells everything related to basic family staples.  She’s a hardworking, very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Thanks to her activity she’s succeeded in moving her children forward.

Leticia’s asking for a loan to buy toilet paper, water, shortening, sugar and also to buy women’s clothing which is her other activity to take advantage of Mother’s Day since she has many pending orders and with the loan’s support she want to meet her need for financing and carry out her project.  Leticia’s dream is to improve her business and her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2013.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Armonia Group

texts.es: Armonía es un trabajador y pagador, lleva 3 ciclos con su crédito. Esta compuesto por mujeres que luchan por  salir adelante con la economía familiar. Jessenia es una de sus integrantes, es una persona joven de 26 años, es casada y tiene una niña de 6 años y un bebé que viene en camino. Jessenia se dedica a la venta de barbacoa y menudo en un puesto, tiene 4 años vendiendo de lunes a domingo y menciona que el crédito la ayudará a invertir en su negocio, ademas dice que quiere meter mas variedad de comida, ya que su puesto esta ubicado en un buen punto y quiere reparar la camioneta en la que cargan las cosas del puesto y con la que surten su materia prima. Su esposo se quedó desempleado hace varios años y los dos se dedican a l mismo negocio, ya que les va muy bien.
texts.en:
“Armonía” (Harmony) is a hardworking, well-paying group; it’s been in three loan cycles.  It comprises women who work to get ahead with the family economy.  Jessenia’s one of the members.  She’s 26-years-old, married and has a 6-year-old girl and a baby on the way.  

She sells barbecue and ‘menudo’ [traditional Mexican soup made with beef stomach in a clear broth or with a red chili base] in a stand; she’s been in business for four years and works Monday to Sunday.  

She mentions that the loan will help her invest in her business.  She also says that she wants to introduce more variety of food because her stand is located in a good spot and she wants to repair the pick-up truck they use to transport the things for the stand and to stock up on raw materials.  Her husband became unemployed several years ago and both of them now work in the same business because they do quite well.

loans.use: to introduce a new fat-food menu and to repair the pick-up truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She sells new clothes in Kabarnet town, which she has been doing four years. She earns an income of 20,000 KES.

Irene is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD for.100,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stock of new clothes to sell. The anticipated income will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for her children. Irene's dream is to improve the living standards of her family and see her business expand.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is 31 years old. She lives in the small village of Ozurgeti District with her husband, parents, sister and her infant daughter. Lana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is her father, who works as an artisan on private orders. It is hardly enough for food, as the income is not stable. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lana requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Lana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Lana will purchase a stock of groceries and resell at higher prices. She has no experience in this field, but she is very motivated to work hard for a better future. Lana hopes that her business will be successful, as she feels the whole family standing by her. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 34-year-old hardworking gentleman and a father of five children between the ages of one and 12 years old. He is married to Silvia, who operates a retail shop which brings additional income for the family.

David is a farmer and also operates a motorcycle transport business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He has acquired a second loan of 40,000 KES which he will add to his savings and purchase a new motorbike for the transport business. 

He hopes to expand his businesses from the increased proceeds. His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tefta

texts.en:
Tefta is a widowed Egjyptian mother of three children who lives in south-central Albania. She is 49 and her children’s ages range from 13 to 27 years old.

“My husband passed away when the youngest one was only 2 ½ years old and it hasn’t been any easy since then financially and otherwise. After he passed away, I started selling used clothes here in the city’s market and have no regrets. Also, I work for other members of my Egyptian community who own their booths and resell used clothes in the local market. I fold their clothes and generate some extra cash from this type of work as well,” Tefta said.

The loan that she is requesting for the first time will help her stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mayerli Sugey

texts.es:
Mayerli de 33 años de edad, casada con un hijo de cinco años, ella es originaria de Managua. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Mayerli se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de su familia en actividades recreativas como ir al cine, al parque. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económico, pero se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa variada como pantalones, blusas, short, faldas, camisolas, vestidos, camisetas, ropa interior, juegos de sabanas, toallas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto, en un lugar específico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Mayerli agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mayerli, 33, is married and has a five-year-old son.  She’s from Managua, a place located in the central part of the country.  Mayerli is noted for being hardworking and responsible with a strong wish for self-improvement.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the company of her family in leisure activities like going to the movies or to the park.  Unfortunately, she was unable to go to university due to lack of economic resources and she had to start working at a young age.

Thanks to her effort and drive to get ahead she has an economic activity selling assorted clothes like pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, camisoles, dresses, t-shirts, underwear, bed linen sets, towels, etc.  She spends about 10 hours daily in her business selling her wares in a specific place in town.  

The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her shop with the purchase of products to sell so that in the not too distant future her income will improve.  Mayerli thanks Kiva lenders for the support they offer people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her shop.

loans.name: Erick Alain

texts.es:
Erick es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su pequeña bebe recién nacido, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Erick pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Eléctrica, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar básquet con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Erick trabaja como técnico, reparando maquinas eléctricas en una empresa de infraestructura de comunicaciones, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Erick se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear, pintar y poner piso de concreto  a la habitación de su bebé, de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor seguridad y bienestar.
texts.en:
21-year old Erick lives in the town of Ica with his wife and newborn baby daughter. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who with his wife puts a lot of effort into helping his family get ahead. Thanks to his own hard work and with help from his parents, Erick was able to study electrical engineering. In his free time he enjoys playing basketball with his friends, and now and again enjoys cooking the delicious dish Tallerines Verdes to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Erick found a job as a technician repairing electric machines for an infrastructure and communications business. He works about ten hours every day and believes all is going well as he is a hard worker and treats other people in a friendly way.

Erick is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to make improvements to his house. He wishes to plaster and paint the walls  and put a concrete floor in his baby's room so she will be safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: Make improvements to his baby's bedroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize and maintain her pineapple plants.

loans.name: Miguelitas Group

texts.es: Miguelitas es un grupo solidario puntual y responsable. Una de sus integrantes es Diana, se dedica al hogar y tiene una papelería desde hace 4 años, con el crédito quiere hacer mas grande su negocio, incluir regalos a la venta y comprar una copiadora mas grande, ya que la que tiene es muy pequeña y no tiene muchas funciones.
texts.en: "Miguelitas" is a supportive, punctual, and responsible group. One of the members is Diana; she is a housewife and has had a stationery shop for four years. With the loan, she wants to expand her business to include the sale of gifts and to purchase a larger photocopy machine; the one she has is very small and doesn't have many functions.

loans.use: to add the sale of gifts and novelty items, as well as to buy a larger photocopy machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 and not married. She lives in Malindi, about 150km north of Mombasa. She has been operating a retail shop for the last one and a half years and now she seeks a loan of 31,500 KES to expand into the food business. When she is free, she does hair plaiting which also provides her with extra income. 

Elizabeth's challenge is the lack of customers, especially in low seasons. She learned about Milango from friends and she decided to join. The loan will enable her to do business and be able to go back to school in the future, which is her ultimate plan.

loans.use: to buy new stock, cooking stove, plates and cups for her food business.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah is a 39-year-old married woman supporting a family of six with the help of her husband Ibrahim. She runs a clothing business in Kapsabet. This has been her income generating business for the last two years, receiving an average monthly profit of 15,000 KES. 

She has borrowed her first loan of 30,000 KES. With this loan she intends to purchase more clothes to sell in her shop. She will use her profits to expand her business by increasing more clothes to meet her clients' demand.

Hawah hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable, as well as expand her business to meet her clients’ demands and expectations.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Wahyu runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Wahyu lives in Bogor, a peri-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Wahyu is married and living with six persons in the family home.  

To increase the family income, Wahyu also works as a dealer. She joined Ruma twelve months ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. For the last three months, she has been earning an average of $100/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

Wahyu is starting to process electricity bill payments for her customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase her income. To provide this new service, Wahyu is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help her purchase this printer so she can offer the new service.

loans.use: to purchase a printer so she can print out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is 55 years old and has been collecting recycling trash cans for cash for the past seven years. She comes from the Egyptian community that lives in rural central Albania. She has two children in their early twenties.
 
“We are all in this type of activity, including my husband and my children. That’s our only source of income and we’re glad to secure the basics from it. We need a loan now to buy some electrical appliances for our home.  We did not have the whole amount of money to pay upfront for the appliances, so getting a loan we thought would become handy,” Bukurije said.

The amount of loan that Bukurije is requesting is 50,000 ALL.

loans.use: to buy some home appliances.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 55-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. She operates a motorcycle transport service. Aside from operating a motorcycle service, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like salt, noodles, canned goods, soaps, cooking oil and toiletries. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy a sack of rice, five cases of Pepsi and a sack of pollard (feed's pig). In the future, Erlinda would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, five cases Pepsi and a sack of pollard (feed's pig).

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar, age 57, runs a family dairy farm. He lives in the small village of Khulo District with his wife, two sons, two daughters-in-law, and three grandchildren. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. They have milk cows and sell cheese products. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow potatoes, maize, and walnut trees. They sell the harvested products locally. The farm produces barely enough to adequately support the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.  

Nodar would like to start up a grocery store business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up capital, but without success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
  
Nodar has now requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. 

With his credit, Nodar will open a grocery store. He will purchase a stock of groceries and also renovate a space near the family house to open his shop. Though Nodar has no experience as yet, he is very motivated to make his new business a success and to increase the income of his family. 

This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store

loans.name: Amirali

texts.ru: Амирали 27-летний молодой человек. Он еще не женат и живет с родителями в районе Кумсангир. Амирали имеет среднее образование. Он трудолюбивый и предприимчивый молодой человек. Амирали на протяжение четырех лет продвигает земледельческую деятельность. Он арендует земельный участок, на котором выращивает овощи, в основном чеснок, лук и морковь. Он запрашивает кредит для приобретения минерального удобрения для обработки земли. Амирали планирует получить богатый урожай овощей и за счет их продажи расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Amirali is 27 years old.  He is not yet married and he lives with his parents in the Qumsangir region.  He has a high school education and he is a hard-working and enterprising young man.  Amirali has been working in agriculture for four years.  He rents a plot of land on which he grows vegetables, mainly garlic, onions and carrots.  He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for his crops.  Amirali plans to receive a big harvest of vegetables and use the proceeds from them to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer to grow vegetables

loans.name: Yassah G.

texts.en:
Yassah G. is 42 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia, which is well-known in Liberia. She is married and has three children, with ages between 24 and 14. They are presently in school and live at home. 

Yassah G. completed 12th grade and, for the past ten years, she has been running a shop where she sells fashionable ladies' handbags. She started this business by selling for her friends, which led to establishing her own business and she learned this way of selling from her friends. Yassah G. is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she learned different kinds of local languages. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fashionable ladies' handbags, to increase her business. Her plans are to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable ladies' handbags, to increase her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 28-year-old businessman who is single. He has been in the transport business for the past four years with a monthly income of 17,100 KES which he uses for his upkeep and school fees for his brother. Simon is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD.  

He will use the loan to buy a new motorbike and employ someone to operate it thus creating employment. With the expected profit from the business he will buy another motorbike to add to his income. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and have a happy family someday.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Gema Del Socorro

texts.es: Gema, es una joven de 27 años de edad, habitante del barrio Milagro de Dios, una zona muy pobre y con mucha delincuencia, ella no quiere que sus dos hijos sigan este camino ellos son de las edades de 7 y 4 añitos y su mayor deseo es que ellos estudien, Gema era casada pero no tuvo éxito en su matrimonio, se separo de su esposo de quien ahora está embarazada siendo su único medio de ingresos la venta de pulpería por el que solicita este crédito por primera vez con Afodenic para invertir con granos básicos, carne, gaseosas, lácteos entre otros que le garanticen la venta diaria, de esta manera intentar salir adelante junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gema is a young 27-year-old who lives in the neighborhood Milagro de Dios. It is a very poor and crime-ridden neighborhood, and she does not want her two sons to fall into this lifestyle. They are 7 and 4 years old; her greatest wish is that they receive a good education.

Gema was married, but her marriage was unsuccessful. She then separated from her husband, by whom she is currently pregnant. Since her only means of income is the sale of groceries, she is applying for a loan for the first time through AFODENIC in order to invest in basic grains, meat, soft drinks, dairy products, etc. that will guarantee daily sales. This is how she intends to get ahead along with her children.

loans.use: to buy grains, meat, soft drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Lirika

texts.en:
Lirika has been a widow for some years now. She is in her early fifties and has no children. Her sister-in-law got divorced a couple months back and she has come to live with Lirika since she had no other place to live.
 
The activity that Lirika has been in for the last 16 years has been agriculture, planting and selling mainly wheat, corn and fodder to wholesale buyers. Her photograph was not taken at her activity because it is the region’s tradition that widowed women cannot be photographed outside their house. Not only that, but they can’t spend too much time outside for other reasons rather than work, to prevent gossips.

Lirika will use the loan to pay for the harvesting of wheat and fodder. This will be her seventh loan, yet she has paid all the previous ones on time.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting of her produce, wheat, corn and fodder.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children between the ages of 14 and 21 years old. She practices horticulture in her farm which has been in operation for over six years earning. She earns an income of 15,000 KES from the sale of farm produce.

She is now servicing a second loan of 15,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for use in the farm.  

The anticipated profit from the sale of produce will be used to improve the living standards of her family and the pay school fees of her children. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Sumera's Group

texts.en:
Sumera, age 28, is a homemaker in Lahore, Pakistan. She is responsible for the upkeep of her home and the care of her three children. She is the leader of this borrower group of two members.

Sumera's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For some weeks now, his rickshaw has not been working properly, which means he is currently unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible, but he does not have the funds to cover the cost of the necessary repairs. 

Sumera has decided to request a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband cover the costs of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business and support his family. 

Sumera is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, 32, has been blessed with two children, aged one and three years. She owns a retail shop in the Eldama/Ravine area and has been in operation for a period of five years. She earns an income of KES 15,700 monthly.

She has been approved for her fourth loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 70,000. Dorcas intends to use this amount to purchase retail stock for her shop, including wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and washing detergents. The profits she earns will be ploughed back into the business, after repaying the loan. Her dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock for her shop, including wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and washing detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial cooker.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna operates a food vending business. In addition to her food stall, she runs a fruit and vegetable selling business. She and her husband are working hard to provide for the family's everyday expenses.

Her previous loan helped her grow her business, as she was able to buy more products to offer for sale, enabling her to earn a higher income. It also helped support the family's household expenditures and pay for her children's education. 

She would now like to apply for another loan to expand her fruit and vegetable stall business. She will use her loan funds in the amount of Kes 15,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale. The expected profits resulting from this investment will help her to sustain her family's daily needs and to meet the educational expenses of her children. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Jesus es casado y tiene 50 años. Despues de mas de 10 años de trabajar en las minas de carbon el sr Jesus resulto con un daño permanente en sus pulmones; desde entonce a decidido llevar una vida mas tranquila y sin arriestar su vida. Desde hace 15 años que se vino a vivir  la ciudad trabajando como chofer de una compañía reconocida en su localidad. El Sr. Jesus compro un terreno y lo empezo a contruir primero de tarimas de madera y posteriormente de concreto, ahora solicita la ayuda por medio de kiva para poder terminar su sueño tener su casa ya terminada.
texts.en: Jesus is 50 years old and married.  After more than 10 years of working in the coal mines, Jesus suffered permanent damage to his lungs and since then has lived a more relaxed life without risking his life.  He came to live in the city 15 years ago and to work as a driver for a company, well known in the area.  Jesus bought some land and started to build on it.  At first he build a wooden foundation, then a concrete one.  Now he is asking for a loan through Kiva so that he can achieve his dream of having a completed home.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Intihuatana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIHUATANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Epifania ella es separada tiene 49 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de uno de los mercados de la zona ,la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, cebollas entre otros, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de pasto por las noches, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras como cebollas, zanahorias, lechuga entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de maíz, venta de florez, venta de ropa, crianza de animales menores, restaurante y maestro de obra.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members all belong to the "Intihuatana" communal bank which is in the Urcos district of the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

Member Epifania is 49 years old, separated and has three children.  She makes a living selling vegetables, having had her business for some years.  The business is going well thanks to her determination at work every day.  Epifania is a street vendor and she works at the door of one of the area's markets.  She sells carrots, onions and more and, at the same time, she works at night selling animal fodder.  She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Epifania is applying for a loan in order to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, lettuce and more.

The other members of the communal bank have various businesses such as selling vegetables, selling corn, selling flowers, selling clothes, raising young animals, a restaurant and as a tradesman.

The member in the separate photo arrived late for the main photo due to work committments.

Epifania is grateful to those helping her achieve her dreams through Kiva and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, lettuce and more.

loans.name: Jesus Miguel

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jesus no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jesus trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el alquila una mototaxi para trabajar y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Jesus cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir gastos de salud, ya que requiere con urgencia realizarse dos endodoncias y curaciones dentales, de esta manera Jesus calmara sus dolencias, asi pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia mototaxi.
texts.en:
24-year old Jesus is single and lives in the town of Ica, Parcona district, with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get on in life. Unfortunately because of a lack of money, he had to get a job at an early age and wasn't able to study mechanical engineering as he wished. In his free time Jesus enjoys playing football with his friends and now and again cooks the delicious dish 'arroz con pollo' to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and after much hard work and dedication, he found a job as a motorbike taxi driver in his town. He rents the taxi and works about ten hours daily. He believes all is going well as he knows well the places where most passengers are to be found.

Jesus is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help he will be able to pay for  his medical expenses. He urgently needs two root canals and other dental treatment. He will then be free of pain and able to continue working to realize his dream of buying a motorbike taxi of his own.

loans.use: To pay for urgent dental treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Azzaya

texts.en:
Mr. Azzaya, 34 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house, on a plot of land. He worked as a serviceman at a building company, for three years. Recently, investment in construction in his area stopped, and it resulted in his loss of his job. Now he works for a transportation entity as a manager, on a three-year contract. His wife has the position of bone settler at a hospital, and she is quite experienced in her profession.

Azzaya is requesting a loan of 5,500,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase building materials, such as planks, bricks, cement and metals. Using these materials, he wants to make an extension to his small, wooden house. As a result, he will be able to create more spacious and comfortable accommodations for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for adding an extension to his family's small house

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 27 years old and a married man. He lives with his three children in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is bachelor level. He has been operating a pharmacy, which offers medical services for customers. He started his business with small capital, to open a pharmacy. He is a good-natured man. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER, which he will use to buy medical supplies for his business. He hopes to grow his business in the coming years and offer more services for customers.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi earns an income by operating a food stall business. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa, and has seven children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Kes 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy larger quantities of meat products, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. 

Mwanarusi expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of meat products, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en: Sadaqat is 41 years old and married with one daughter. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and daughter in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayil refugee. Sadaqat works selling native fruits and vegetables, such as apples, lemons, and others. She is a hardworking and enterprising women who is getting ahead and making an effort to grow .She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for over seven years. Sadaqat’s goal is to continue expanding her business. Her profit from this business is 115 AZN. Now she needs a loan of 1700 AZN to buy more fruitwood. This is her first loan. Sadaqat appreciates your support

loans.use: to buy more fruitwood

loans.name: Umud

texts.en:
Umud is a youth client, who is married, 23 years old, and the father of one kid. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee.

For the past two years, he has been raising sheep, because mutton is in high demand in this region. 

Umud's monthly income is 100 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his wife. He keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes, such as kebabs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Umud is applying for a loan of 1,800 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) in order to buy 12 sheep. He is optimistic about this loan, because, in summer, more people consume meat due to the holidays.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altanchimeg, age 29, is a translator at a building company. She has been working in this position for many years, translating mainly between Chinese and Mongolian. She lives with her parents and her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a small barn on a plot of land surrounded by block fences. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 MNT in order to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, she intends to build an extension to her small wooden barn. This will help her family to live in a warmer and more comfortable place. The renovated dwelling will also reduce the family's coal usage, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants. 

Mrs. Altanchimeg is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build an extension to the small barn where her family lives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 25 years old and an energetic man, with many dreams to fulfill. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan could help him to expand his business. He has been running a shop selling ladies' items, like cosmetic products, hair dryers, skin creams, and costume jewelry. His current stock is limited, and with the loan capital, he would purchase a variety of new items to attract more customers. This would increase his net sales and income. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy a variety of new inventory for the shop where he sells personal items for ladies, like skin creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, chicken, fizzy drinks, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Huaraypata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HUAYRAYPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Claudia ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y galletas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de flores y plantas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the communal bank “HUAYRAYPATA." This bank is located in the district of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cuzco. 

The individual member of this group is Mrs. Claudia. She is married and is 48 years old with two children. She works selling groceries. She sells items such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, cookies and more. She works from 8am to 10pm and has had this business for 8 years. Everything is going well and her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is asking for a credit to purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and cookies. 

The other members in her group sell animals, flowers and plants, as well as run a grocery store and sell agricultural products.                                                                                                                                                                                           

Mrs. Claudia is thankful to those who are a part of making her dream come true and promises to dedicate herself to repaying her loan in the pre-established time frame.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and cookies.

loans.name: Flamboyan Ii Group

texts.en:
“Flamboyan II” is the name of this group of sixteen members, located in a small village called Kroya. This group has been running since 2008, and currently has had eight loan cycles. 

There are various types of businesses in this group, especially traditional foods such as egg rolls, sausage solo, wet pastel, donuts, nagasari, kueku, lemper, Mendut, semar mendem, beans, onions, and risoles. There is also a free-range chicken business. Mutual trust and mutual cooperation among members are very closely intertwined. They always meet every month and take turns at each member’s house. With this loan, they plan to buy the means of production to better increase their return and buy cake molds which are more sophisticated for cake production.
 
Nurul is the leader of this group and is remarkable because she can provide encouragement to the members. She has a business of refilling mineral water, called "Hijau Daun". The Kiva loans benefit her, as Nurul is a widow with two children. Her husband died a few years ago. Nurul hopes this loan can help to add a gallon of mineral water to her production each day.  

The loan can also help the welfare of each member of the group, Flamboyan II, and their families.

loans.use: to add a gallon of mineral water to her production each day.

loans.name: Jepkechei

texts.en:
Jepkechei is a married lady, aged 40, and her children are aged between 15 and 10 years. She practices horticulture on her farm and has been in operation for a period of four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She is receiving her second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, and intends to use this amount to till the land and raise several vegetable seedbeds. The profits she earns from the sale of her farm produce will be used to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan.

Jepkechei‘s dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to till more land and raise vegetable seed beds.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 36-year-old, married man, with four sons and one daughter. Hasan works as an employee in the public sector. This wage is the only source of income for the family. 

Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Hasan to buy all the necessary home appliances, especially a water filter and refrigerator. This will improve the family's living conditions.

Hasan's brother appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith operates a business buying general merchandise from wholesalers, to resell at a profit. She sells clothing for women and children, and also has a food stall. Customers are attracted to Judith's store by her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Judith earns a minimum of KES 200, every day.

Judith is requesting to borrow KES 50,000. She will use the loan to buy an additional stock of kids' and ladies' clothes, along with other ready-to-wear products. She dreams that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of kids' and ladies' clothing, along with other ready-to-wear products.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has 2 children. Mouhammad is the only provider of the family.

Mouhammad owns a bakery and provides his neighborhood with bread. Mouhammad gained his experience through working for several years at a bakery. In 2011, after gaining all the needed experience, Mouhammad established his own business and now he has 3 employees hired.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to renovate his bakery. He believes that this renovation will attract more customers and thus it will increase his productions and profits, which he will use to pay the school fees of his 2 children.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery

loans.name: Zobia

texts.en: Zobia is 34 years old and a hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is a videographer and makes movies of weddings. He has been doing this work for nine years. He is a very skilled and expert movie maker and his clients are very well satisfied with his work. Currently, he requires a high resolution video camera to make the best quality movies. For that purpose, Zobia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a new camera to do his work with more efficiency in the future. This would also increase his net income and savings. Zobia is very hopeful for this loan as this could solve many of their financial problems. With the profit amount, Zobia would pay her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a video camera for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 31 years old. He lives in a small village of Ozurgeti District, with his wife, parents, grandmother, and an infant daughter. His grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. Ramaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Besides Ramaz's grandmother's pension, the only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have milking cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown.  They sell the harvested produce and dairy products locally, at good prices. They earn hardly enough for food, for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ramaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ramaz has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Ramaz will purchase a stock of groceries and open a shop. By running the grocery shop, he will be able to increase the income of his family and make a better future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and start up a new grocery shop

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, age 54, is the proud mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that he can offer them a good and respectable life. He owns a small workshop where he manufactures wipers. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Robina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan funds to purchase rubber and wooden rods for manufacturing wipers. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Robina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rubber and wooden rods for manufacturing wipers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Al-Ehsan 14182 Group

texts.en:
Ihsan is the featured borrower of Al-Ehsan 14182 Group; she is the one with the white burka covering her face. She got along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Ihsan is a 62-year-old widow, who has worked for ten years in preparing and selling Mouneh (conserving food from season to another); she also prepares handmade souvenirs and gifts for several occasions. Her portion of the loan will be invested in buying the necessary products she needs to start Mouneh preparations that must be prepared before the winter season, since customers highly consume Mouneh food during winter.

Dania is the first from the left; she has sold accessories and makeup for the last five years. She is a 30-year-old married woman, mother of three children. Her portion of the loan will be invested in buying special summer offers with competitive prices.

Manwa is the first from the right; she is a 48-year-old married woman, who has worked as a tailor for the last six years. She is well known in her region. Her portion of the loan will be invested in buying necessary tailoring needs such as threads, fabrics and accessories needed.

Nazira is the one holding her beloved baby girl; she is a 25-year-old married woman, who has been working as a makeup artist for a year. Her portion of the loan will be invested in buying special summer cosmetics and nail colors. She will also use part of this loan to buy a small refrigerator for her house.

loans.use: to buy necessary products she needs to start Mouneh preparations

loans.name: Yomaira Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Machalilla en el cantón Puerto López, lugar rodeado de hermosas playas y de muchos atractivos turísticos como el Parque Nacional Machalilla el cual ofrece muchos atractivos de los restos de la cultura ancestral, este lugar es muy visitado en toda época del año. 
 
Aquí vive la señora Yomaira, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 

Doña Yomaira para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de productos naturales,  ella sele en las mañanas a  vender su productos porque es más fresco y sus hijos están en sus centros de estudios, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, ya son 3 años que viene dedicada  a este tipo de ventas y le va muy bien. Ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en las faenas de pesca.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales y materiales de pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The 24 De Noviembre communal bank meets every fortnight in the Machalilla parish in the Puerto López canton, an area surrounded by beautiful beaches and many tourist attractions such as the Machalilla national park which has a lot of attractions in the form of remains of ancestral cultures. This area is well frequented throughout the year.
 
This is where Yomaira lives, she is 26 years old, she is married and from this relationship, the couple have two children aged 6 and 12 who go to school and secondary school. Her husband makes a living fishing.

To earn a bit of money, Yomaira makes her living selling natural products. She leaves in the mornings to sell her products because it is cooler and her children are at school. She sells the items on credit and collects on a weekly basis. She has been performing this work for 3 years and it is going very well. She will also give part of the loan so that her husband can use it for his job fishing.
 
She will use this loan to buy natural products and fishing material. She has been part of the communal bank since the beginning and likes it due to the help given with the loans. 

Yomaira's dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy natural products and fishing materials.

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Liberación Femenina se reúne cada quince días en Puerto López, lugar rodeado de hermosas playas y de muchos atractivos turísticos, todos los años llegan las ballenas jorobadas a aparearse acontecimiento que atrae a muchos turistas en esta época del año.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y  vive en la casa de los padres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio que hoy le permiten ganar algo por su cuenta. 

Ella es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante por sus propios medios, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 15 días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, uniformes de escuelas y ropa  interior para niños para aprovechar la época de entrada a clases. 

Su sueño es tener un local para vender sus prendas.
texts.en:
The "Liberación Femenina" ["Women's Liberation"] communal bank meets every fifteen days in Puerto López, a place surrounded by beautiful beaches and many tourist attractions. Each year, the humpback whales arrive here to breed, an event that attracts many tourists at that time of year. 

In this place lives María, who is 22 years old. She is single and lives in her parents' house. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because with the loans she was able to start her business, which now allows her to earn something on her own.

She is a very hard-working young woman who enjoys getting ahead through her own efforts. She works selling clothing of all kinds. Her sales method is door to door, and she also sells from her home to the customers she knows best. She sells to her customers on credit and collects payments every 15 days. She has dedicated herself to this work for two years, and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, school uniforms and children's underwear, to take advantage of the season when classes begin. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing, school uniforms and children's underwear to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 27 years old. He is married with one child. He owns a bookshop and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more paper reams and hard disks for sale. He plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: To buy more paper reams and hard disks for sale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 25 years old. She sells electronic equipment and has been doing for a couple of years. Before she has been selling shoes but after realizing the demand for radios and chargers, thus why she shifted from shoes to sell electronics. With the loan, she wants to buy more radios and chargers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more radios and chargers for sale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in Mombasa town, Kenya. He is 31 years old, married, and has a rwo-year-old child. He is a teacher. In addition, he has a cereal and pulses shop, which he has been operating for the past four years.

He heard from a friend about Milango, and he immediately joined. Now, he is seeking a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings {KES}. The loan will enable him to increase his stock. The major business challenges that he faces are unpredictable price changes, and the high cost of transportation of goods.

Emmanuel wants to operate a wholesale shop in Mombasa dealing in cereals, one day. He also wants to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy more grains and pulses to resell, including maize, greengrams [mung beans], wheat and rice.

loans.name: Mawaya

texts.en:
This is Mawaya, a resident of Likoni, Mombasa. She is married to a businessman, and she is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She works hard continually, to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She applied for a KES 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional mineral water to resell at her business. The more mineral water she has in stock at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional mineral water for her business.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang, age 24, lives in Akhmeta District with his parents and brother. The only source of income for the family is from growing different kinds of fruit on a half hectare of land and selling the harvested products locally. Though they are able to sell their produce at a good price, it is still hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vakhtang would like to start a taxi business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to obtain family business start-up capital, but without success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
 
Vakhtang has now requested a loan from Credo to start up his taxi business, and he has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due their low income. 

With his credit, Vakhtang will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Thareigter

texts.en:
Thareighter, age 49, owns a salon business. She has been operating this venture for the past 10 years. She and her husband live in Mombasa, Kenya, and have three children, two of whom attend school. She and her husband both work hard to support the family.
 
She joined Milango after she heard about the organization from its marketing officers. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 41,900 Kenya shillings, which she will use to buy more materials for her business, such as chemicals and hair braids. 

Thareighter hopes eventually to open more businesses so that she can diversify her earnings and employ more people.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her salon business, such as chemicals and hair braids

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru: Садафмо замужем. Ей 53 года. Она является матерью четверых детей. Её сыновья работают за пределами страны. Садафмо со своей семьей проживает в районе Джиликуль, на юге страны. Садафмо имеет среднее образование. Она трудолюбивая и спокойная женщина. Садафмо не боится тяжелой работы, она 10 лет своей жизни посвятила сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Садафмо занимается посевом хлопка, пшеницы и риса. Ей в деятельности помогает муж. Садафмо берет кредит для закупа минерального удобрения и топлива. Она за счет продажи урожая планирует сыграть свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Sadafmo is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Her sons are working outside of the country. She and her family live in the Jilikul district in the south of Tajikistan. Sadafmo has a secondary education and is a calm, hardworking woman. She is not afraid of hard work and has dedicated ten years of her life to farming. Sadafmo plants cotton, wheat, and rice, and helps her husband with his work. She took out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel. She is planning to use the profits from her crop sales to plan her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Martha ella es soltera y tiene 46 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y lencería, la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos,medias entre otras ropas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de transporte, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Dos De Mayo. This bank is located in the district of Cusco within Cusco province in the department of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

Martha is one of its members. She is 46 years old, single, and has two children. Her business is selling clothing and lingerie. She works selling sweaters, pants, shirts, hosiery, and other clothing items. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm by bringing her merchandise to different places and establishments, and among friends. She has been in business for eight years so far and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to open a store where she could sell her clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to buy sweaters, hosiery, shirts, pants, and jackets.

The other members work selling fruit, in transportation, running a grocery store, and selling beauty supplies.

The members attached to the group photo had their picture taken later on because they had requested to be absent for work-related issues.
