Martha is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream. She promises to comply with the terms of her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, hosiery, shirts, pants, and jackets.

loans.name: Afzal

texts.en:
Mr. Afzal is 33 years old. He lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with his family. His family is comprised of two children and his wife. Afzal has been running an embroidery supplies shop for 12 years. Presently, he is in need of purchasing new embroidery items, because his current stock is almost finished. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand his business. With the loan financing, he would add more space to his shop. In addition, he would purchase new inventory, including cloth, needles, lace, and a variety of stones and thread, to resell at his shop.

He is currently living in a rented house, so his wish is to purchase his own house in future. He is hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one, for his family.

loans.use: To add more space to his shop, and to purchase more embroidery materials to resell

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima prepares and sells such food items as chapati (flatbread), cooked beans, and rice to earn an income. She started this enterprise about four years ago. The business, due to her considerable effort, is doing very well. 

Mwanalima and her husband have seven children, all of whom are still enrolled in school, and she is dedicating her efforts toward securing their education and advancing their future. Thanks to her hard work, she is ensuring the children's schooling and supporting the family's needs. She wishes to continue working and investing in her business so that she can have the means to continue helping her children. She adds that through her labors, she also helps two other families by providing them with work.

Mwanalima is soliciting this loan for use in buying merchandise for her stand, including wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking oil. She also wishes to invest in purchasing tables and chairs. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, since it will be of so much help.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela, age 42, lives in the small village of Telavi District with her husband, their young son, and her parents-in-law. Lela’s husband works in transportation and gets a small monthly income. Her parents-in-law are provided with a small retirement pension. Though they pool their income, it is hardly enough to provide sufficient food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lela would like to start a clothes trading business. She is experienced in this field as she was involved in a trading business three years ago. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to obtain family business start-up capital, but without success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Lela has now requested a loan from Credo in order to start up her clothes trading business, and she has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With her credit, Lela will begin trading in clothing items. She plans to go to Turkey, where she will purchase clothing from wholesalers, and then she will resell these items among her local villagers at a higher price. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a clothes trading business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La Sra. Benita, es comerciante y tiene su negocio en su casa, tiene una despensa y comedor, con buen movimiento comercial ya que esta en una zona muy recurrida, tiene una clientela formada , pasajeros, asalariados. Comenta que al principio le costó un poco, pero que después de mucho esfuerzo ha podido mejorar y hoy ya es muy conocida en el barrio.
Su objetivo es mantener  y fortalecer su puesto de trabajo, por esta razón ha recurrido a la fundación y a Kiva, y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos, huevos y demás, ya que son insumos que utiliza mucho.
texts.en: Mrs. Benita is a businesswoman and runs a business from her house. She has a small store and restaurant. She has a lot of customers, as she is located in a busy area. Her customers are has regulars, travelers, salaried workers, etc. At first she had to invest some money in her business, but afterwards, with a lot of effort, she was able to improve her business. Now she is well known in her area. Her objective is to maintain her business and improve her workplace. This is why she has found KIVA. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs and other items that she uses frequently.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez, age 52, is the leader of this borrower group. She and her husband have four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband offers sheltering services. Kaneez is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Kaneez hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for her husband's sheltering business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala, age 43, is a widow with two children. She has been running a grocery store for the past eight years. She has gained a great deal of experience during this time and her son helps her in the business. Her profit from this business is 180 AZN. This will be her third loan from Aqroinvest, and she has a good loan history.

Due to dwindling business capital, Kamala's business profit has recently decreased as her goods reserve has drastically declined. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN in order to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities. As a result, she will be able to continue to sell foodstuffs without worrying about an inventory shortage. 

Kamala is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a merchant in Likoni, Mombasa. She owns and operates a food stall. She starts very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night. Maria has been doing this work for more than three years and she has become very well-known among the customers at the market.

Maria is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. This is why she works so hard. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes. These are the items she most needs and uses every day.

She is grateful for this opportunity because she knows she will make progress and grow her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPEREMOS-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas la socia tiene 48 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende todos los días desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de útiles escolares, negocio de venta de vinos, venta de ropa, trabajadores del sector estatal.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “May We Prosper – Cusco” communal bank located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                              

Felicitas, a member, is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. She operates her own grocery store and has done so for a good while. The business is going well, thanks to her efforts. It's open every day from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm. She wants to continue working in this manner in order to help her family.

Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks for her business.

The other members are dedicated to businesses such as restaurants, grocery stores, school supplies, selling wine, clothing, and workers for the state.

The member in the separate photo in the corner of the picture requested permission to arrive at the meeting late due to his work schedule. The person whose face is covered doesn't belong to the communal bank.

Felicitas is grateful to all the lenders who become part of her dream, and she is committed to complying with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 28 years old. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employee in the government sector, getting a low salary which is not enough to cover his family's needs. 

He requested a youth loan of YER 50,000 to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him do his homework and reports. This will ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan, age 36, runs a small cattle-farming business. He buys a young calf, raises it, and sells it for meat. He is a very hard-working person and he likes his agricultural occupation. With the profits from his farming, he meets his family’s needs and, whenever possible, he helps pay for his children’s education as well. Guloglan and his wife have three children.

He has decided to increase his animal-breeding enterprise, so he has requested a loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN. This is his fourth loan. He will use his loan funds to buy young calves and fodder for his animals. He hopes to receive more profits from his expanded animal-breeding endeavor in future. 

Guloglan is confident that his Kiva loan will bring success to his agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy young calves and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, age 45, is widowed with one child who is attending college. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya, where she operates a grocery store. The major challenge she faces is high prices. She is also employed for extra income.
 
She heard of Milango through a friend and decided to join the organization. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 41,850 Kenya shillings, which she will use to buy vegetables and fruit to offer for sale.  
 
Her goal is to earn enough to be able to pay school fees for her child in college. She also wants to open more businesses like M-pesa.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell in her store

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: La Sra. Natividad  tiene 51 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta y  crianza de cerdos y venta de quinua  en la localidad de Batallas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Natividad    va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para crianza y venta de los mismos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos ya que esta actividad necesita mucho capital ya que también se compra alimento balanceado para una  buen alimentación,  La Sra. Natividad  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Señora Natividad is 51 years old.  She makes a living selling and raising pigs and selling quinoa in the town of Batallas.  

This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Señora Natividad is going to use the loan to buy pigs for both raising and selling.  Her reason for requesting the loan is her lack of capital to buy the pigs since this work needs a lot of capital because she also buys balanced feed for a good diet.  

Señora Natividad faces challenges in her business, like improving her quality of life, and she is going to use the profits to improve the quality of food for her pigs.  Her wish is to be able to have a farm where she can raise a large number of pigs so that in this way she can improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 50 years old and a mother of three children. She is a shopkeeper. Sevda has dedicated 25 years of her life to this occupation. Besides this, she is a very caring mother. After several difficulties in life, such as her house catching fire, Sevda is now more determined in her business.

Now, she wants to use this loan to buy more products for her shop, in order to increase the revenue and to have enough money to repair her house.

Sevda has already taken three loans from Aqroinvest Credit Union in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for a fourth loan of AZN 1,800.  She hopes that the loan will help make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy more products for shop.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu, age 47 and widowed, is a dairy farmer. She is a kind and hard-working person. She has dedicated 13 years of her life to her agricultural activities, and she has become an experienced farmer. 

Arzu brought up her three children alone after her husband's death. They are 17, 23, and 25 years old. All her efforts have been and will be for the sake of securing their education and providing for their future. She herself has only a secondary education. Her eldest son works abroad and the second-eldest is studying in Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan. Her youngest son (pictured with her) helps her at home and with her agricultural activities. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1600 AZN in order to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kevin Gregory

texts.es: Kevin  de 19 años de edad, es soltero y se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Odontología en la Universidad. La duración total de la carrera es de 5 años y el lleva estudiando 2 años desde que inició. Actualmente se encuentra prestando servicios de apoyo en un consultorio dental, generando  ingresos el cual lo destina para pagar sus estudios. El está muy entusiasmado y motivado en terminar su carrera, ya que son sus padres quienes le dan la fuerza para poder salir adelante. Uno de sus mayores retos es el poder estudiar y trabajar a la misma vez, es por eso que le pone mucho entusiasmo y dedicación a sus estudios. Su objetivo para el futuro es convertirse en un odontólogo  y en un profesional de éxito. Kevin usara el crédito en el pago de cuotas de sus estudios por adelantado a fin  de no tener la preocupación de pagar cada fin de mes. El  agradece a las personas que la ayudan a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Kevin, 19, is single and studying Dentistry at university.  The total course requires five years and he’s been in it for two years.  He currently works as an assistant at a dental clinic earning income he earmarks to pay for his studies.  He’s very excited and motivated to complete his career; his parents give him the strength to be able to continue forward. One of his greatest challenges is to be able to study and work at the same time which is why he puts so much enthusiasm and dedication into his studies.  His future objective is to become a dentist and a successful professional.  Kevin will use the loan to pay for his tuition in advance so that he can avoid the worry of having to pay at the end of each month.  He thanks the people who will help him reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
This is Mwanaisha. She previously accessed a Kes 15,000  loan that she used to buy more quantities of products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for the personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another Kes 15,000 loan to purchase more kerosine for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres valiente  es de la ciudad de San Pedro,  está integrado por 13 señoras muy emprendedoras actualmente están en el 2do ciclo y todas están trabajando por ayudarse y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo que hacen.
Todas las mujeres son de campo y se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás, con lo cual luchan por dar a sus familias lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Mabel es la presidenta y una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y otros alimentos para sus animales, y así seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" is from the city of San Pedro and comprised of 13 women entrepreneurs who are in their second loan cycle.  All of them work for themselves and their families.

All of the members are farmers who raise and sell animals such as chickens, pigs, goats, etc., to earn an income to provide their family with the daily necessities.

Mabel is the president of the group and a very hard-working entrepreneur who struggles hard to get ahead.  She is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals so she can continue growing her business.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is 25 years old. She lives in Kutaisi District with her husband, Guram. Several times, Khatia requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a small income of her husband, working as an artisan. It is hardly enough money for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Khatia requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Khatia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With this credit, Khatia will begin to trade in clothing. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin to trade in clothing.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 29 years old. He lives in Chiatura District with his wife, mother, and five-year-old son. 

Several times, Davit requested loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a small one, locally working as an artisan. It is hardly enough money for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Davit requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Davit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Davit will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her photocopy machine and her printing machine

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 57 years old and married with three children. He has been selling rice, beans, eggs, spaghetti, chicken, meat, and more for ten years. Tahir's business is in his home, and his customers are his friends and neighbors who visit him from Monday through Sunday. His sales are very good.

Tahir is asking for a 2000 AZN loan to buy products for his grocery store such as rice, beans, eggs, chicken, meat, salami, pasta, bread, soft drinks, juices, and milk to be able to earn more in his business. This investment will help him stock more inventory, thereby increasing his income to cover household expenses and financial commitments. 

Tahir dreams of having a better store that is more appealing and comfortable for his customers, improving his living situation, and expanding his business. Tahir hopes that the loan will help make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy products for his  grocery store.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala, age 41, sells food products such as tea, sugar, and sweets, as well as common household items in her market shop. She has been engaged in this business for the past five years. She is a very hard-working woman and knows her business by heart. She has good relationships with her neighbors and clients, many of whom buy products daily from her market. 
 
Kamala is unmarried and lives with her parents, who are in ill health. She divides her time between taking care of her parents and managing her store. Thanks to her business, she generates the income necessary to support the family. Her monthly business profit is 170 AZN. She loves her work and puts her heart into it.
 
At present, Kamala does not have enough funds to buy many needed inventory items for her store. For this reason, and because she has a good loan history, Kamala is requesting her fifth loan from Aqroinvest. Repaying this loan is her top priority, as is evidenced by her positive loan history.
 
With her loan funds of 1,900 AZN, Kamala will invest in her business by buying a variety of products to offer for sale.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying a variety of products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Bocar

texts.fr: Monsieur  Bocar  est un homme marié et il vit au Sénégal avec sa famille. Il est couturier et ce métier lui procure des  revenus lui permettant d’entretenir sa famille. Il s’adonne depuis 3 ans à la confection d’habits qu’il  revend a la population de la localité de sa zone d’habitation. Il est membre à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC auprès duquel il sollicite un prêt de 150.000 francs. Son but est de se servir de cette somme pour acquérir les tissus qui lui permettent de confectionner les divers modèles d’ habits prêts a  porter qu’il expose a la vente. Ce financement  pourra contribuer a développer son activité de commerce d’une part et d’autre part est un support consistant pour appuyer sa volonté de développer son activité.  Par conséquent, il pourra facilement épargner plus d’argent. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de diversifier encore plus les modèles qu’elle confectionne, Pour mieux développer son activité, il envisage de faire des voyages dans la sous de région pour acheter des tissus.
texts.en:
Mr. Bocar is a married man who lives in Senegal with his family. He is a tailor, a profession that allows him to earn the revenue needed to support his family. For the past three years, he has been making apparel that he sells to the population of his district. He is a member of the local U-IMCEC branch, where he is seeking a loan of 150,000 francs. He plans to use this credit to purchase fabrics that he will use to make a selection of ready-to-wear apparel  for sale. 

This loan will help him to expand his business activity by providing ongoing support for his determination to succeed. As a result, he will be able to save more money and the increased profits will enable him to further diversify the various styles of apparel that he sews. To help expand his activity, he plans to travel to the sub-region to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make apparel for sale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a recurrent client of Yehu Microfinance. She is married and her husband is employed; he works as an office messenger at Kenya Port Authority. 

Bahati has had a grocery store since 2011. She has repaid several loans to date. She is asking for this one to buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, tea, and other goods to offer a wider variety to her customers. With a greater variety of products to offer her customers, she will earn a larger profit margin that will help to improve her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, tea, and other goods.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, age 40, sells milk to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past 10 years and currently has three dairy cows. She sells milk to her neighbors, as well as the butter that she makes from the milk. She has three children and her business helps her to offer them a decent life. She is very motivated by the goal of providing them with happy living conditions, a good education, and plentiful food and clothing. She has improved her business over the years in order to better meet the family's everyday expenses. 

This is Zubaida's second year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through the support of her lenders. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of Rs. 30,000, which she will use to purchase another cow. This will allow her to see an increase in the production capacity of milk for her business, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Ms. Zahida has had a business making shoes for many years. A few years ago, she did not have enough capital to expand her business activities. She was afraid to take an informal loan from relatives, so she contacted Kashf Foundation at the suggestion of her neighbor. She is a mother of three and responsible for her children's basic necessities including food, health, and education. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to afford her children’s education. Now, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy additional material for making shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles.

loans.name: Jovenes De Belen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jovenes de Belen está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de jovenes, donde todos trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están trabajando y esforzándose para poder ayudar a sus familias y poder sentirse útil con un pequeño ingreso.
Mercedes es una de estas integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de bijouterie, con lo cual se está esforzando por tener un pequeño sustento para su casa y ayudar a sus papas con la carga del día a día. El sueno de Mercedes es poder ser el día de mañana una gran microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Bijouterie, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en lo que le gusta, que es trabajar y ayudar a su familia. Cabe destacar que en la foto del grupo estan diez personas ya que también aparecen los codeudores de este préstamo, quienes son familiares que apoyan a estos jóvenes.
texts.en:
The group called Jóvenes de Belen (Youth of Belen) is in its third cycle of the communal bank program. They all work and help each other to move ahead. They are working and striving to be able to help their families and to be able to feel they are useful with a little bit of income.

Mercedes is one of these members. She sells costume jewelry, and with it she is trying to provide a little bit of support for her household and to help her parents with the day-to-day load. Mercedes' dream is to be able to be a great micro-businessperson in the future.

She is asking for this loan to buy costume jewelry, and with it she will be able to continue working and investing in what she likes, which is to work and help her family. It is worth noting that in the group photo there are ten people, since the co-borrowers on this loan also appear. They are family members who support these young people.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Yuri Anis

texts.es: La joven  Yuris, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad llamada la Francia junto a su Familia, ella sueña con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, desde hace muchos años tiene  su propio negocio vende frutas y verdura y genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos del hogar su  mama trabaja como domestica, con este credito comprara Bloques, Cemento, Arena para continuar continuar con la construccion de su humilde hogar, Agradece el apoyo y confianza que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Young Yuris lives with her family in the municipality of Ticuantepe in a community called La Francia.  She dreams with improving her living conditions.  For many years she’s had her own business selling fruit and vegetables and she generates income to help with household expenses.  Her mother works as a domestic employee.  She will use this loan to buy concrete blocks, cement and sand to continue building her humble home.  She is grateful for the support and the trust Afodenic and Kiva funds have given her.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Ondina Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Ondina habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su hijo, mujer trabajadora, humilde, lucha dia a dia para poder mejorar sus condiciones vida, y darle a su hijo un mejor futuro, desde hace mucho tiempo tiene su propio  negocio vende y verduras al por mayor,  en el mercado del municipio, gracias a su negocio a podido superarse, actualmente ella le urge reparar sui casa ya que con la llegada del invierno teme que sufra de daños o inundaciones, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara  Materiales como: Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Piedras cateras etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ondina lives in the municipality of Masaya with her son. She is a hardworking and modest woman who fights everyday to improve their life conditions and to provide her son with a better future. She has had her own business for a long time selling vegetables in bulk in the municipality market. Thanks to her business, she has been able to self-improve. 

She currently needs to repair her house as she fears it might be damaged or suffer from flooding during the winter. She will use the loan to buy construction materials, such as blocks, cement, sand, iron, stone, etc. She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva Microfunds for the support received.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 38 años de edad, se dedica a elaboración y venta de calzado y bisutería como aretes, pulseras y collares; ella vive en Cartagena, con su cónyuge y sus  3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 15 años. Su oficio artesanal lo inició desde hace 3 años, por la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. Sus clientes principales son las droguerías y misceláneas, a las cuales les vende sus productos a crédito y con una frecuencia diaria, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y realiza sus compras de contado en el mercado de la ciudad donde encuentra sus insumos a  muy buenos precios. En la actualidad  Mercedes está aplicando a  su primer credikiva para invertir en insumos como cuero, broches, pintura, hilos, agujas, suelas y accesorios para la elaboración de calzado y los artículos de bisutería (aretes, pulseras, collares). Con esto pretende mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos, pues tiene como meta personal adecuar las instalaciones de su cocina, para sentirse mucho mas satisfecha.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 38, works manufacturing and selling shoes and costume jewelry like earrings, bracelets and necklaces.  She lives in Cartagena with her spouse and three children aged 10 to 15 years.  She started her artisanal work three years ago needing to improve household income.  Her main customers are drugstores and novelty shops that she sells her products to on credit daily from 8 in the morning to 8 at night.  She makes her purchases from in the city market paying cash; that’s where she finds her supplies at good prices.

Currently, Mercedes is applying for her first Kiva loan to buy supplies like leather, clasps, paint, thread, needles, soles and accessories to continue making shoes and costume jewelry items (earrings, bracelets, and necklaces).  Her intention with this is to improve sales and income since her personal goal is to remodel her kitchen so she can feel more satisfied.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco de 36 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Cynthia de 34 años , el Señor es emplado de una empresa  reconocida  desde hace mas de 10 años pero  con su  poco sueldo  apenas y les alcanza para  los gastos del hogar y para los  estudios de sus dos hijos Tania de 16 años que esta estudiando la preparatoria y su hijo Cesar de 14 años que esta cursando el primer año de secundaria  el dia de hoy  el esta solicitando un prestamo para  impermeabilizar su casa y pintarla  de exterior  ya que en temporadas de lluvia se le transima  demaciado  la humedad  y eso proboca que se le este callendo la pintura es por eso que requiere el prestamo para comprar impermeabilizante y pintura, el agradecera el apoyo que se le pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is 36 years old and is married to Cynthia (34 years old). He has worked for a well-known company for over 10 years but his low salary is not enough to cover their household expenses and the tuition of their two children: Tania, who is 16 and in her pre-university year, and César, who is 14 and in his first year of secondary education. 

He is requesting a loan to waterproof his house and to paint the exterior given that, during the rainy season, the high humidity level causes the paint to fade. He is grateful for the support he might receive.

loans.use: to waterproof and paint his house.

loans.name: Viviana Esther

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Viviana, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar calzado al por mayor y multiplicar su negocio. Cuando recibió su credikiva su negocio cambió, pues compró artículos de mayor rotación y su vida ha mejorado. Viviana  dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por ayudar a los personas de bajos recursos. “  En la actualidad requiere comprar productos de papelería, útiles escolares, artículos de lencería y electrodomésticos para responder al mercado, que ya ha hecho sus solicitudes de pedido. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva con el cual visiona el éxito de esta inversión, basado en su experiencia y en dar una respuesta oportuna a su clientela.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Viviana, who was able to buy footwear wholesale and thus grow her business substantially thanks to a previous Kiva loan. When she received her loan, her business changed, as she was able to purchase high turnover items, thus improving her life. Viviana tells her Kiva lenders : "thank you for helping people whose incomes are low". At this time, she needs to purchase stationery, school supplies, lingerie and electrical appliances to meet customer demand, as customers have already placed their orders. This is the reason that she is asking for another Kiva loan; based on her experience, if she is able to meet customer demand, she believes that this investment will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, school supplies, lingerie and electrical appliances

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 37 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Segundo no culminar sus estudios secundarios y eso no le permitió estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta reparar celulares y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Ahumado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Segundo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de reparación y venta de accesorios de celulares, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como chofer de mototaxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Segundo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina, repuestos y accesorios para celulares, de esta manera Segundo tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Segundo’s a 37-year-old single man living in the city of Pucallpa.  He’s a very humble, hardworking and enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because he needed to go to work while still very young in order to help out his parents, Segundo was unable to finish secondary school which kept him from being able to study Law like he wanted to.  In his free time he enjoys repairing mobile phones and sometimes cooks delicious smoked fish to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Segundo works in his small mobile phone repair and sales business.  In addition, on weekends he works driving a mototaxi providing transportation services in his city.  He works every day for about 12 hours and believes he does well because of the good prices and the courteous treatment he provides to his customers.

Segundo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a display case, spare parts and accessories for mobile phones and this way Segundo will have his business better stocked and he will be able to take care of more customers so he can continue working and striving towards reaching his great dream of expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy a display case, spare parts and accessories for mobile phones.

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL PROGRESO DEL VALLECITO” está conformado por 6 socios trabajadoras y responsables en las cuotas grupales. Quienes se sienten contentos por encontrarse pasando el sexto ciclo. Ana es presidenta del grupos tiene 37 años es conviviente con 4 hijos dependientes. Cuenta con una bodega que implemento en su vivienda hace 4 años en donde ofrecer productos de primera necesidad: arroz azúcar y bebidas a la vez se dedica a distribuir productos de la sierra del centro como queso leche, queso, quinua y maca. De esta manera ayuda a su esposo con los gastos y educación de sus hijos  quien se dedica a brindar servicios de taxi. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia . El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Ana es la tercera persona del lado derecho viste  casa negra y buzo beige.
texts.en:
El Progreso del Vallecito Group is made up of six hardworking members who are responsible with their group loan payments.  They're happy to be in their sixth loan cycle.

Ana, 37, is the president of the group.  She has a live-in partner and four dependent children.

Ana has a small grocery store that she set up in her home four years ago where she sells basic staples: rice, sugar, and beverages.  She also works distributing products from the central highlands such as cheese, milk, quinoa, and maca [a native Andean root vegetable].  This way she helps her husband, a taxi driver, with the expenses and their children's education.

She'll invest the loan in buying rice, sugar, and oil.  Her greatest wish es to finish the construction of her house and to give a better quality of life to her family.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Ana's the third person from the right; she's wearing beige pants and a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Kamsap Kaquini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KAMSAP KAQUINI” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Aleida es la Secretari. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, tejido de mantas, venta de tacos de zapatos, venta de ropa americana, venta de frescos y gelatinas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Aleida es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su prima que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pollos a la Broster); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, en conjunto con la ayuda de su familia, actualmente ya tiene su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la adquisición de equipos (compra de heladera) que adquirirá de las tiendas y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera pero vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “Kamsap Kaquini” communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board with Aleida as its secretary.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: milk sales, blanket weaving, shoe heel sales, American clothes sales, blended fruit and gelatin treat sales and food sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro-business women like Aleida.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from her cousin who’s a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling food (Broaster-style chickens).  She makes it known that she started this business years ago with support from her family and currently has her own business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy equipment (purchase a cooler) that she’ll buy from stores and then set up at home.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her home the best possible way since she’s single living with her parents.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El joven Carlos es originario de san Rafael del sur, municipio de Managua, Nicaragua.
Es un joven luchador, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja para una empresa de seguridad y bombeo, tiene cuatro años de laborar para esta empresa. 

También pertenece a un grupo musical el cual están empezando tiene una año, en su tiempo libre trabaja en la musica.

 Es casado su esposa es comerciante alquila un tramo en el mercado y vende ropa variada usada.
El dinero lo solicita para la compra de instrumento musical como es una guitarra eléctrica y una batería.

Con mucho esfuerzo  y con los financiamientos que les ha brindado ceprodel junto con kiva, es que ha logrado cumplir algunos de sus sueños. es una personas que se siente agradecido por el apoyo que se les ha brindado. Y esperan que le sigan apoyando con los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Young Carlos is a native of San Rafael del Sur, a municipality in the department of Managua, Nicaragua. He is a tenacious young man, with a strong desire to get ahead. He works for a security and pumping company; he has worked for this company for four years. He also belongs to a musical group that they are starting; the group is a year old. In his free time, he works on his music. 

Carlos is married; his wife is a merchant. She rents a spot in the market and sells various used clothing. He is requesting the money for the purchase of musical instruments, like an electric guitar and a drum kit. With great effort and with the financing that Ceprodel and Kiva have allowed him to successfully complete some of his dreams. He is a person who feels grateful for the support provided, and he hopes that they continue supporting him with financing.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments (an electric guitar and a drum kit).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Kofi is an entrepreneur. He specializes in taxi driving in Edukuma (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 12 years. Kofi is married and has six children. His wife works as farmer. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts, thus aiding him to improve his overall business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, thus aiding him to improve his overall business

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 34 years old, married, and has one son and one daughter. He began his business selling products for household use 5 years ago. His goal is to become independent and to improve the economic condition of his family. His profit from this business is 120 AZN. His son helps him to sell products.

With the aim of purchasing general merchandise and increasing sales, he is asking for a loan due to his lack of capital. He is certain that his investment will allow him to increase his clients and his income.

He has already taken five loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a 6th loan, this time for 2000 AZN. With this money, he wants to buy more products and to expand his business in the future. His good client history is a little proof that he can do this.

loans.use: to buy more products and to expand his business in the future.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 37 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. Two of the children, aged 8 and 5, attend school. He is a mechanic, and he has been doing this work for the past 15 years. He also does welding at his place of work. He heard of Milango through friends, and he is applying for a loan of 62,650 KES (Kenya shillings) to help him buy a gas welding machine. He also earns extra income by buying and selling scrap metal. He will use the extra income to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to add more welding machines to the existing ones, in order to serve more customers. Mechanic’s tools are very expensive for him, and that is his major challenge

loans.use: to buy a gas welding machine for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Mrs. Nazia is a vigorous lady; she has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand from her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine, more spools of thread in various colors, and packets of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing her revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, more spools of thread in various colors, and packets of laces, zippers and buttons for her sewing business.

loans.name: Sanjuana

texts.es: La Sra.  SanJuana  tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada (paca) , ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  mismo que trabaja como tornero en una empresa , pero ella consiente de la situacion economica,  busca seguir en mejora continua  siempre  y dar de ella lo mejor para su familia  ,el dia de hoy esta solicitando un prestamo para  invertir en su negocio nos comenta que necesita comprar mas Ropa ya que esta temporada de Verano es  muy buena  para ella  pero no tiene la mercancia  suficiente para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo  que buscan es por eso que ella necesita el credito para comprar mas Ropa y asi incrementar sus ventas e ingresos . ella tiene planeado pagar el credito con las ganacias de su negocio.
texts.en: Sanjuana owns a small business selling used clothing (bundles). She gets support from her husband who works as lathe operator for a company. However, conscious of their financial situation, she always seeks constant improvement and tries to give her family the best of herself. She's currently requesting a loan to invest in her business. She reports that she needs to buy more clothing, since this summer season is very good for her, but she doesn't have enough merchandise for her customers to find everything they want. That's why she needs the loan in order to purchase more clothing and therefore increase her sales and profits. She plans to repay the loan with the proceeds from her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en: Ms. Chanda is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making costume jewelry, as she has been for many years. The business has great potential for growth, and Chanda is actively helping her husband, as this business is a main source of income for them. She has four children, all of whom go to school. In order to meet orders on time and boost her sales, Chanda applied for a loan of RKR 30,000 to buy raw materials, such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls, for her business making jewelry.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is a 25-year-old client with 2 children. His business is a small grocery store. 
He requires the loan to purchase butter, rice, beans, sugar, water, milk, eggs, coffee, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. With the loan and the increased inventory available in his store, he hopes to increase sales and to be able to take better care of his customers.
He hopes to meet his basic needs and to improve his family's quality of life. He hopes his business continues to grow and that, in a few years, it becomes one of the largest and most well-known grocery stores in the district. He also wants to continue supporting his children so that they grow up to be good people with better opportunities in life.
He has already taken 3 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a 4th loan of 1500 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest in the business and buy more products in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: To buy more products for his store in order to generate more revenue

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a petty trader at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe. Celestine has received schooling to the middle school level.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is also a petty trader. 

Celestine has been a petty trader for 10 years now. She assists her husband with the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to operate a grocery store where she would sell items such as soap, can minerals, milk and tooth paste. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her old age and also expand her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, such as dresses, pants and blouses, for resale.

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres microempresarias una de ellas es Paula es una mujer que tiene 37 años de edad, acompañada, tiene dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 4 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisetas de varón, blusas de damas, camisas Holister, cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, cremas faciales, perfumen de varón, perfumen de damas etc. Sandra tiene 33 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Edda tiene 36 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three small business owners. One of these is Paula. She is a 37-year-old woman with a partner and she has two children who are minors. For more than four years she has run her business selling cosmetics and new clothing. She will invest the loan in buying clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's t-shirts, women's tops, Hollister shirts, hand creams, body creams, facial creams, men's perfume, women's perfume etc. 

Sandra is 33 years old and runs a small grocery store from her home and Edda is 36 years old and has a business selling clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's t-shirts, women's tops, Hollister shirts, hand cream, body cream, facial cream, men's perfume, women's perfume etc.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Doña Sandra, tiene 38 años de edad habita en un barrio que se llama 38 de Mayo en Managua, una zona en donde la mayor parte de los pobladores son de escasos recursos,  ha sido madre soltera, sola ha trabajado y apoyado a sus hijos quienes hoy en día son mayores de edad e independientes, ella tuvo muchas dificultades cuando no tenía un hogar propio, pero ahora ha recibido la donación de un pequeño terreno gracias a un proyecto social en donde pudo improvisar una casita, su único medio de ingresos es la venta de dulces elaborados por ella misma los que vende en las calles de manera ambulante, por lo que solicita crédito para poder comprar materia prima para hacer los dulces y comprar una pequeña cocina industrial ya que la que tiene es artesanal y es un poco arriesgado  y cansado por las condiciones, así con las ventas podrá cubrir sus gastos primordiales.
texts.en: Sandra is 38 years old and lives in a neighborhood called 38 de Mayo, in Managua, an area of mostly low-income inhabitants. She's a single mother who has worked and supported her children all by herself. Today her children are independent adults. She faced many hardships back when she didn't have a home of her own, but now she has received a small plot of land as a donation from an outreach program and there she set up a small, improvised house. Her only means of livelihood is selling sweets that she herself makes. She sells them in the streets on a door-to-door basis. She requests the loan in order to purchase supplies for making the sweets. She'll also buy a small industrial kitchen, since the one she has now is handcrafted and it's a little risky and worn-out. That way she'll be able to use her sales to afford her primary expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, coconuts, and an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Brobyn

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Brobyn from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Brobyn is married and  his wife stays at home. He has four children between the ages of one and 16. His oldest child attends school and they all live at home. Brobyn completed school through grade 12. 

For the past five years, Brobyn has owned a cement depot. On average, he works 15 hours a day. He started his business with money from his father. Brobyn's major business challenge is the rainy season. He transports his cement by truck and his favorite part of the business is his good location.

Brobyn is requesting a loan to purchase more cement and inventory. In the future, he would like to build a house and open another shop. Brobyn thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 46-year-old businessman from Liberia.  He is married and has three children, between the ages of 10 and 2.  Two are currently attending school and they all live at home.  Hassan completed grade 2 before starting his business.  He describes himself as a hard-working man.

He lives and works in Paynesville North, which has the largest market in Montserrado county.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, the local term for traders who travel to the interior regions of the country to purchase goods to sell throughout the county.   Because of this, there is a large number of wholesalers operating in the area that distribute to the markets in the county, including supplying the capital city of Monrovia. 

Hassan has a  general store which sells milk, rice, sardines, mayonnaise, etc.  For the past four years,  he has worked  12 hours per day at his business.  His greatest challenge in business is goods shortages.  He intends to use the loan to buy inventory. He started his business by selling for his father.  He likes his business because he makes profit.  He hopes to one day own two to four shops.  

Hassan wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Ms. Farzana, age 40, is a married woman who deals in the business of purchasing and selling animals. Nine years ago, she started her own business to provide financial support to her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation; currently she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Marlene Leticia

texts.es: Marlene de 37 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de verduras y elaboración de vinagre para curtido desde hace varios años tiene su negocio lo tienen ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, Marlene esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas verduras por mayor y los ingredientes para elaborar el vinagre y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old and sells vegetables and makes vinegar for pickling vegetables for a living. She has had her business for a few years. It is located in the market near her home. With the earnings from her sales she manages to cover her household costs. She lives with her husband and son in their own house. 

Marlene is applying for a loan to be able to buy more vegetables at wholesale prices and the ingredients to make vinegar, to be able to give her family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables at wholesale prices and ingredients to make vinegar

loans.name: Nagma

texts.en: Ms. Nagma, age 35, is a married woman and a mother of four.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver but his income is not sufficient to provide for his household alone. So Nagma is striving hard to fulfill her children's needs for things such as food, clothing, and education. She started her business of stitching clothes at her home. She buys ladies cloths from the market and after stitching them, she sells them in her community. She is quite familiar with stitching techniques and makes enough to contribute to the family income through her business. Due to low cash-in-hand, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy stocks of cloths with some spools of thread in different colors. It would help her to meet the orders of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cloths and some spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is 36 years old. He lives in a small village in the Kobuleti District with wife, mother, and two daughters. Oleg requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Oleg trades fruits and vegetables; this is the only source of income for his family. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family is categorized as subsistence poor.

Oleg requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Oleg will open a bakery. After the bakery is opened, he will bake Georgian bread to sell and will be able to increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy professional sound equipment.

loans.name: Isaías De Jesús

texts.es:
Isaías de 52 años de edad, es un hombre luchador y esforzado, su familia es su mayor bendición y la mejor motivación para levantarse cada día y trabajar fuertemente. Aprendió el oficio de ebanistería desde hace más de 20 años, gracias a la oportunidad que tuvo de laborar en un taller.
Con esta actividad ha sacado su familia adelante y le ha brindado educación a su hijo. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos como madera, pegante, espuma y tela con el  fin de mejorar su ventas y cumplir con los pedidos solicitados.
Su mayor sueño es adquirir vivienda propia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Isaías, 52, is a tenacious and valiant man. His family is his greatest blessing and the best motivation to get up each day and work hard. He learned the trade of woodworking more than 20 years ago, thanks to the chance he had to work in a workshop. He has advanced his family with this activity and given his son an education. Now he is asking for a loan to buy supplies like wood, glue, foam, and fabric in order to increase his sales and fill orders. His greatest dream to have his own home and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wood, glue, foam, and fabric.

loans.name: Yorman Alexander

texts.es:
Yorman es un joven emprendedor y con un futuro promisorio. Sus ganas de salir adelante le han permitido alcanzar grandes logros en su vida. Hoy cuenta con su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas, labor que le permite generar los recursos necesarios para colaborarle a su madre y pagarse sus estudios. Sueña en convertirse en un gran microempresario y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas. 
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus ventas y aumentar el número de clientes, con el objeto de montar en un futuro próximo un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Yorman is a young entrepreneur with a promising outlook. His will to succeed has helped him achieve great goals in life. He has today a fast-food business and this is how he receives an income, helps his mother and pays for his studies. His dream is to become a micro entrepreneur and this is why he is requesting a loan to invest in supplies needed to prepare the food he sells.

His biggest dream is to improve his sales and attract more customers, so that he can open a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia tiene 34 años es casada tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 15 años, que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida ella vende pollo frito Pacumuto tiene su puesto de venta   que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  La señora Alicia es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La señora Alicia les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un frizer y mesas y sillas para brindar comodidad a su clientes, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Alicia is 34, married, and has two children ages 8 and 15 who are in school. She sells a fried chicken dish called Pacumuto. Her stall is located in El Torno. Alicia is a very hard-working person who, with dedication, has acquired stability and solvency bit by bit. She has also gained popularity; she is very well-known because she provides very kind customer service. With the money from this loan, she will purchase a freezer and tables and chairs for her customers' comfort. She tells us that she will be able to expand her business more with a lot of hard work. She will be able to keep building a heritage for her family's well-being, as well as for her personal well-being. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and tables.

loans.name: Mauro Julio

texts.es:
Mauro es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Mauro no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mauro trabaja en su pequeño negocio de vulcanizado y soldadura, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.

Mauro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la renovación de sus herramientas y mantenimiento de sus equipos de trabajo, de esta manera Mauro podrá seguir brindando sus servicios, así pues poco a poco el desea poder lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda completa a de servicios de vulcanizado, soldadura, venta de repuestos y lubricantes.
texts.en:
Mauro is a 33-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and 3 children whom he loves and who are his principal reason for living. He is a very likable, hard-working, and enthusiastic person and, alongside his wife, dedicates all his efforts to advancing his family. Lamentably, for lack of economic resources, and due to necessities, he has had to work from a very early age. Mauro was unable to study for the professional mechanic career he desired. In his spare time, he likes to cook a rich “Chicken Escabeche” to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with great effort and dedication, Mauro works in his small tire repair and welding business. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that he is doing well, due to his experience and the kind treatment he offers others. 

Mauro is very grateful to Kiva investors, since thanks to the help they offer, he will be able to renovate his tools and maintain his working equipment. In this manner, Mauro can continue offering his services, and, then, little by little, he wishes to achieve his grand dream of having a complete store and service center for vulcanization, welding, and selling replacement parts and lubricants.

loans.use: to renovate his tools and maintain equipment in his small tire repair and welding shop.

loans.name: Manuel Rodrigo

texts.es:
El cliente Manuel vive en Guayaquil. El comenzó por que la mamá lo mando a que aprenda la profesión de confesionista poco a poco le fue gustando ese oficio.  Hasta que ya en la actualidad el realiza el trabajo solo  y en diferentes horarios ya que los pedidos los tiene que entregar en un tiempo establecido.

Su dificultad es la enfermedad  de la esposa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar maquinas y implemento. 

Su sueño es hacer cuartos de alquile, mejorar el negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mejores maquinas y poder viajar a otras provincias para vender lo que el confecciona que es ropa de hombres y mujeres.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Guayaquil.  He started because his mother sent him to learn the tailoring profession.  Little by little he started liking this trade.  He now works alone and on different schedules.  This is because he has to deliver the orders that he has at an established time.

His difficulty is his wife’s illness.  He wants to use the loan to buy machines and sewing implements.

His dream is to make rooms to rent and to improve his business.  He wants to use the loan to buy better machines and to be able to travel to other provinces to sell.  He makes men’s and women’s clothing.

loans.use: to buy machines and sewing implements.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La clienta Maria vive en Guayaquil. Empezó con un proyecto de comenzar un negocio para tener mas ingresos viajando a Perú a comprar ropa (ya que la ropa en Perú es mucho mas económica que en Ecuador) poco a poco en viajes comenzó a tener clientela. 

Su dificultad en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde ella vende la ropa.Tiene dos niños los cuales estudian en escuela fiscales. 

Con el préstamo  va a comprar  tela y faldas para poder incrementar su mercadería. Su sueño es tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Guayaquil.  She embarked on a project to start a business so that she could have more income.  Maria travels to Peru in order to buy clothing since the products over there are much less expensive than they are in Ecuador.  Through her trips, she gradually began gaining customers.  

Her difficulty with her business is dealing with the crime that exists in the area where she sells clothes.  Maria has two children who are studying at state schools.  With this loan, she will buy fabrics and skirts so that she can increase her inventory.  Her dream is to have her own shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy skirts and fabrics.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has four children and a total of six members in her home, and her husband is the only earner of the family.

It was very tough for Samina to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband, so she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose, she started her business of cloth trading as she bought cloths of different varieties from Lahore and Faisalabad market and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family.

In order to inflate her sales, she applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more varieties of cloths in different colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of cloths in different colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ms. Ramzana is a 46-year-old, married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her five children. 

To make her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.  In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She has been in association with Kashf for four years. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia Brigida vive en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores y la venta de jora de chicha,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia Brigida solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Brigida lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  She still has her business raising small animals and selling jora de chicha, a corn liquor.  She has had her business for years and it is doing well because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep working so he can keep supporting her family. 

Brigida is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. 

She is thankful for the loan she has been offered and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth vive en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco,la socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores y comestibles,la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a sus negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia Yaneth solicita el credito para la compra de aceites y sacos de arroz para su negocio de venta de comestibles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yaneth lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  She belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank.  She still has her business raising small animals and selling groceries.  She has had her businesses for a while and they are doing well because of the effort she puts into them every day, which is how she is getting her family ahead. 

Yaneth is asking for a loan to buy oils and bags of rice for her business selling groceries.

She is thankful to those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oils and bags of rice for her grocery business

loans.name: Letty Leonor

texts.es:
La cliente Letty vive en Machala (provincia enriquesida de cultivos), comenzó su negocio cuando le refirieron que el cultivo de ají y otros productos orgánicos eran muy buenos para vender y que le iban alquilar hectarias de tierra para poder cultivar. Poco a poco cultivando y vendiendo el cultivo de aji pudo tener capital para poder tener un mayor sembrado. 

En la actualidad sigue con su negocio. La cliente Letty cultiva el aji y lo vende por quintal. Una de sus dificultades es para trasportar su cultivo. Tiene una niña que estudia en una escuela particular. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas para su hija ya que quiere que este bien de salud para cuando comience las clases. En el futuro tiene muchas aspiraciones por eso quiere seguir con su negocio y que su hija este muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
Letty lives in Machala (a province enriched by crops).  She started her business when she was told that chili pepper crops and other organic products were very good to sell, and they were going to rent her hectares of land for her to be able to farm.

Little by little she was cultivating the land and selling the chili pepper crop.  She was able to have capital in order to be able to have more plants.  She now continues with her business.
